page.title: 06EARDINGTON MILL
page.content:
{ Eardington mill}was used in 1910. Nowadays only the building remains,but on the wall you can still see the markings of the water wheel mountings. Next to the water wheel there was a small Bakery where local people got their bread from. Inside the mill is an{apple grinding stone. Next to the mill were 2 cottages,and by it is a small stream.Over the stream is a wooden bridge.In the mill they made paper as well. Nearby is a {track}with some logs so they could take their carts down. In the wood there is a boggy place where it is said a{cow once sunk}under the ground completely.
It is said that the old mill wheel has been taken to the U.S.A.
